tag_list: michael, lopez, teenager, programmer, designer, developer, blogger
overview:
Michael Lopez is a 17-year-old blogger, web design, programmer and student in upstate New York. Michael is the founder of Mspy2.com which provides technology and web service reviews for teens. Michael was formally a host and producer of the KidTech podcast, before it abruptly ended in late 2006. Michael is also the co-founder and lead designer of Manlius Web Design, a small web design firm in his home town.

Michael is currently a junior in high school in New York.

In December of 2009, Michael won the “Disability Rights: 2009 Communications Campaign Contest”. The campaign was sponsored by Assemblyman Al Stirpe, in partnership with Syracuse Universityâ€™s Burton Blatt Institute, the S.I. Newhouse School of Public Communications and Clear Channel Communications.
